concept.title: Field Splitter
concept.shortdesc: The Field Splitter splits string data in a field based on a separator character and passes the separated data to new fields. Use the Field Splitter to split compound string values into individual components.

conbody.p: For example, if a field contains an error code and error message separated by a dash, you can use the dash to separate the error code and error message information into different fields.

The Field Splitter separates values into new fields based on the separator characters in the record. When splitting a record would result in more fields than expected, the Field Splitter can either include the remaining data as part of the last field or discard it.

When splitting a record would result in fewer fields than expected, the Field Splitter can either pass data without the additional fields, discard the record, write the record to an error file, or stop the pipeline.

section.title: Example
section.p: Say that a Field Splitter uses a comma to separate data into two fields and to discard records that cannot be split as requested. When it encounters a single comma, it passes the data before the comma to ErrorCode field and the data after the comma to the ErrorMessage field. If it encounters a second comma, it can either discard the extra data or include it in the last field.

When the Field Splitter processes the following records:
GM-302,information that you might need ME-3042,message about this error,"additional information from the server" IMD-03234

If you discard the extra data, the Field Splitter produces the following records:
ErrorCode GM-302 ME-3042
Message information that you might need message about this error
If you keep the extra data, the Field Splitter produces the following records:

stentry.codeblock: Message information that you might need message about this error,"additional information from the server"

section.p: Note that in both cases, the Field Splitter drops IMD-03234 because the record does not include enough data to be split.
